org.hps.digi

Class PulserDataReadoutDriver<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.readout.ReadoutDriver
        • org.hps.digi.PulserDataReadoutDriver<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - - The object type for the pulser-data objects managed by this driver.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RawTrackerHitReadoutDriver

    public abstract class PulserDataReadoutDriver<E>
extends ReadoutDriver
    Class PulserDataReadoutDriver is responsible for taking in pulser-data objects from a source file with (MC + pulser data) overlaid events and feeding them to the ReadoutDataManager. It is also responsible for performing any special actions needed when a triggered event is written, if necessary.
    Author:
    Tongtong Cao

      The output flags that should be used for the handled data collection when written to LCIO.

      • collectionName

        The name of the pulser data collection that is handled by the driver.

        The modified name of the pulser data collection. The collection name is modified to be different with names of other collections.

        The output flags that should be used for the handled data collection when written to LCIO.

      • setCollectionName

        public void setCollectionName(String collection)
        Sets the name of the pulser-data collection that is handled by this driver. Note that this must match the name of the collection used by pulser-data, and will also be the name of the output data collection.
        Parameters:
        collection -

      • getIDDecoder

        protected IDDecoder getIDDecoder(String collectionName)
                          throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                 UnsupportedOperationException
        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Gets the IDDecoder needed to read the cell IDs for the objects produced by the indicated collection. This will result in an exception if the requested collection is not managed by this driver.
        Overrides:
        getIDDecoder in class ReadoutDriver
        Returns:
        Either returns the ID decoder used by the specified collection.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the requested collection is not managed by this driver.
        UnsupportedOperationException - Occurs if there is no IDDecoder object for the specified collection.

      • getTimeDisplacement

        protected double getTimeDisplacement()
        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Specifies the amount of simulation time that the driver needs to produce its output. This indicates that the driver's present output was generated based on input a time equal to (getCurrentTime() - getTimeDisplacement()).
        Specified by:
        getTimeDisplacement in class ReadoutDriver
        Returns:
        Returns the time displacement of output data as a double.

      • getTimeNeededForLocalOutput

        protected double getTimeNeededForLocalOutput()
        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Specifies the amount of simulation time that the driver needs to produce special on-trigger data.
        Specified by:
        getTimeNeededForLocalOutput in class ReadoutDriver
        Returns:
        Returns the time displacement of output data as a double.
